$!You must tell DVLA if you have scotoma.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don't tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you're involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download 'V1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 251KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065620.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download 'V1V - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 261KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065275.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have scotoma - download the correct form to let them know
title: Scotoma and driving
